security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with no executable code, no network access, no file system operations, and no external dependencies. All code examples are purely illustrative documentation. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Apply Planning Guidelines for Portfolio Buddy
content.value_statement: Features for Portfolio Buddy 2 need careful planning to preserve existing code and work across mobile and desktop. This skill provides clear principles for code preservation, responsive design patterns, and decision frameworks that ensure consistent, maintainable development.
actual_capabilities: Guide code preservation decisions when adding features
Provide mobile and desktop responsive design patterns
Structure clarifying questions with recommended options
Define risk assessment checklists before changes
Establish integration workflows with other Portfolio Buddy skills
limitations: Specific to Portfolio Buddy 2 codebase patterns
Does not execute code or access project files
Requires loading alongside architecture-reference for full context

use_cases.title: Add New Features
use_cases.description: Extend Portfolio Buddy 2 with new features while preserving existing code patterns and conventions

use_cases.title: Implement Responsive UI
use_cases.description: Add or modify UI components that work correctly on both mobile and desktop viewports

use_cases.title: Review Code Changes
use_cases.description: Evaluate proposed changes against established principles for risk and complexity

prompt_templates.title: Add New Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use planning-guidelines to add a new feature to Portfolio Buddy 2. Apply code preservation principles and ask clarifying questions before implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Create Responsive Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a responsive component using Tailwind patterns from planning-guidelines. Verify mobile and desktop layouts work correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate Code Change
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this proposed change using the risk assessment checklist from planning-guidelines. Is it low risk and reversible?

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the decision tree from planning-guidelines. Should we preserve existing code or propose improvements? What are the trade-offs?

best_practices: Extend existing code before replacing it - preservation is the default
Verify every feature works on both mobile (base classes) and desktop (sm:, md: prefixes)
Ask clarifying questions with recommended options marked before ambiguous implementation tasks
anti_patterns: Refactoring working code without clear justification or user approval
Adding features without testing responsive layouts on both viewports
Guessing at requirements instead of asking clarifying questions

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for planning and implementing features.

faq.question: What types of changes have low risk?
faq.answer: Isolated changes to single functions, easily reversible modifications, no ripple effects on other features.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other Portfolio Buddy skills?
faq.answer: Load it first for principles, then use planning-framework for algorithms, coding-standards for implementation, and migration-tracker for documentation.

faq.question: Is user data handled safely?
faq.answer: This skill contains only documentation - no code executes, no files are accessed, no data is transmitted.

faq.question: What if the risk assessment fails?
faq.answer: If risk criteria are not met, preserve existing code and ask the user for guidance before proceeding.

faq.question: How does this differ from planning-framework?
faq.answer: Planning-guidelines provides core principles and patterns; planning-framework offers specific algorithms like Musk's 5-step method and ICE scoring.
